did.unittitle: John R. Thompson, Richmond, Virginia, to Thomas A. Greene

scopecontent.p: [Thompson informed Greene, an autograph collector, about the death of his sister and sent him a list of autographs that he sent to Greene. He also mentioned an Excise-Book [sic] of Robert Burns. ]

did.unittitle: John R. Thompson, New York, New York, to B. Johnson Barbour

scopecontent.p: [Thompson wrote briefly to Barbour to inform him when he would be in Richmondnext.]

did.unittitle: R. F. Walker, Richmond, Virginia, to Edward Denham

scopecontent.p: [Walker wrote that he was not able to obtain the autographs that Denham was seeking. He also mentioned the autographs of Lee and Jackson. He enclosed a newsclipping (below) with details of the life of John R. Thompson. ]

did.unittitle: B. Johnson Barbour, Barboursville, Virginia, to Edward Denham

scopecontent.p: [Barbour wrote that he could spare a letter of John R. Thompson's for Denham. Walker's letter (above) was enclosed with this letter. The postscript mentions a letter Barbour found of Thompson's which he sent.]
